definition: innate sense of right and wrong/conscience/bosom friend
instinctive understanding, esp. of ethical issues (idiom); untrained, but with an inborn sense of right and wrong/innate moral sense

sentences.chinese: 我们的良知不允许如此。

sentences.english: What is the point of our bad conscience?
sentences.chinese: 我们的错误的良知到底是为了什么？

sentences.english: Emilia is the voice of conscience in the play.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉亚在这出戏中是良知的代言人。

sentences.english: A firm and solid will could awaken our wisdom, not just our conscience.
sentences.chinese: 若是道心坚固，就能够启发我们的智慧，不只是良知。

sentences.english: Chewbacca became Solo's conscience of sorts.
sentences.chinese: 丘巴卡的良知和索洛的不尽相同。

sentences.english: But you cannot take away my freedom to be true to my conscience.
sentences.chinese: 但是你不能剥夺我信守我的良知的自由。

sentences.english: This paper also mentions the modern significance of Wang's Conscience Theory.
sentences.chinese: 文章还提及了阳明良知说的现代意义。

sentences.english: At least she had the conscience to stand uop and realize what she'd done wrong.
sentences.chinese: 至少她还有良知，站出来，认识到自己做错了。

sentences.english: Barry Goldwater IS the conscience of a conservative.
sentences.chinese: 戈德华特是一个保守的良知。

sentences.english: "Intuitive knowledge" is an important category of Yangming's psychology.
sentences.chinese: “良知”是阳明心学的重要范畴。

sentences.english: They say vengeance taken will tear the heart and torment the conscience.
sentences.chinese: 俗话说复仇是撕心裂肺的痛楚，是折磨良知的苦涩。

sentences.english: I suggest you start a support group for bankers with a  conscience.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你为有良知的银行家设立一个支援组织。

sentences.english: A proposal to honor the New Orleans cocktail known as the Sazerac has gone down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 一项表彰纽奥良知名鸡尾酒萨泽拉克的提案泡汤了。

sentences.english: This article originally appeared in the Summer 2002 issue of Conscience.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章最早出现在2002年的《良知》夏季刊。

sentences.english: The crying baby then could by no means call up his conscience.
sentences.chinese: 哇哇啼哭的婴儿也无法唤醒他的良知。
孩之宝之外，还存在合乎良知的替代品。

definition: human nature/humanity/human/the totality of human attributes
instinctive understanding, esp. of ethical issues (idiom); untrained, but with an inborn sense of right and wrong/innate moral sense
to have a sense of shame
